content: <?xml version="1.0"?> <rdf:RDF   xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"   xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/"   xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom"   xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/" >  <channel rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=BOOK-HISTORY&v=1.0">  <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=BOOK-HISTORY&v=1.0</dc:identifier>  <title>BOOK-HISTORY List</title>  <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BOOK-HISTORY</link>  <description>BOOK-HISTORY List Archives</description>  <dc:date>2015-01-23T13:39:49Z</dc:date>  <image rdf:resource="http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif"/>    <items>   <rdf:Seq>     <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;16ee4565.1501"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;a276661.1501"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;922cd73e.1501"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;34b8ee3d.1410"/> <rdf:li resource="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;96a286ca.1407"/>     </rdf:Seq>  </items>   </channel>  <image rdf:about="http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif">     <title>Powered by L-Soft's LISTSERV mailing list manager</title>     <link>http://www.lsoft.com/products/listserv-powered.asp</link>     <url>http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif</url> </image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;16ee4565.1501">   <title>Re: London Rare Books School - 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;16ee4565.1501</link>   <description> Apologies all for the email incorrectly sent.<br><br>Louisa Hunter-Bradley<br><br>Sent from my iPhone<br><br>&gt; On 23 Jan 2015, at 12:32, Christopher Adams &lt;christopher.adams@SAS.AC.UK&gt; wrote:<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Applications are now invited for London Rare Books School (LRBS), from 29 June \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 3 July 2015 and 6 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 10 July 2015.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; The application form is available from the Institute of English Studies website. Courses are \ufffd\ufffd600, and a \ufffd\ufffd50 deposit is requested upon application. Bursaries are available.<br>&gt;<br>&gt; Early bird special: Two courses for \ufffd\ufffd1000 (until 15 April 2015)<br>&gt;<br>> A limited number of partial bursaries (funding by [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T13:39:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Louisa Hunter-Bradley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;16ee4565.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;a276661.1501">   <title>Re: London Rare Books School - 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;a276661.1501</link>   <description> Dear Christopher,<br><br>I am a phd student specialising in the printing and distribution of music in the Low Countries in the sixteenth century. Your second course advertised is extremely interesting and I would live to attend but have already agreed to present at a conference for those dates. Is there any way that I can pay for the materials provided for the course so that I am able to learn some of what you have on offer anyway. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T13:17:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Louisa Hunter-Bradley</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;a276661.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;922cd73e.1501">   <title>London Rare Books School - 2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;922cd73e.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;922cd73e.1501">London Rare Books School - 2015 </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T12:32:53+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Christopher Adams</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;922cd73e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;34b8ee3d.1410">   <title>AMARC conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;34b8ee3d.1410</link>   <description> The British Library will be hosting an AMARC Conference on 1st December on 14th-century illuminated manuscripts, in honour of Lucy Freeman Sandler.<br><br>We have just moved the conference to a larger venue, so more places are now available.<br><br>The following is a link to our most recent blog post about the conference, which provides all the relevant details: [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T13:04:45+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sarah Mahurter</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;34b8ee3d.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;96a286ca.1407">   <title>Paper Knowledge: Towards a Media History of Documents </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;96a286ca.1407</link>   <description> [cid:image002.jpg@01CF9C27.0CC57B00]Paper Knowledge<br><br>Toward a Media History of Documents<br>Lisa Gitelman<br>"Four intriguing essay make up this tantalising and ambitious short book. Each starts at a vivid point in the overlapping history of media and technology, and proceeds to meander around an ink-stained group of colourful characters and long-forgotten committees [...] Through these windows on the recent past, [Gitelman] subjects printing, copying, documents and paper to an analysis that is both fresh and grounded in the practices and prejudices of media studies [...] The strength of this bold volume is in its argument that we can learn a great deal if [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-07-10T09:09:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charlotte Boyle</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BOOK-HISTORY;96a286ca.1407</dc:identifier> </item>   </rdf:RDF>
